DOC.brief_summary: Has the maternal KIR haplotype an impact in pregnancy, miscarriage and live birth rates per embryo transfer in donor oocytes -ART by paternal and oocyte donor HLA-C?
DOC.brief_title: Maternal and Fetal Compatibility in ART-oocyte Donor Influences Live Birth Rate
DOC.detailed_description: The combination of maternal KIR haplotype and parental, donors HLA-C, could predict which couple can benefit for the selection of SET/DET, or donor selection by HLA-C in ART, in order to increase the LBR/cycle since HLA-C1/C1 donors are predicted to be safer and C2/C2 males or oocyte donors may be mor "dangerous" as identified by epidemiological studies
DOC.criteria: BMC between 19 27. Blastocyst embryo transfer previous. Normal karyotype, thrombophilic and immunological results. Normal clinical history, viral serology, hormonal analysis (TSH, T4, prolactine, estrogen, progesterone), spermiogram, sperm FISH and pelvic ultrasound results. Pregnancy women. Psychiatric disorders. Uterus alterations. SOP. Genetic and autoimmune diseases. Infectious diseases. Corticoid and immunosuppressant treatments previous.
